intro: Oxyanthus unilocularis, commonly known as the single-chambered oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has palmate leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are usually bisexual, with five petals and numerous stamens, contributing to its ornamental value. Oxyanthus unilocularis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
